languageKey.label: Series represents a list of related sermons.
A sermon series is a common structure used in the church to denote a series of sermons inter-related by a common topic. The series record stores information that is specific to the series itself.
The language of this series.
This should be the default language unless this series represents a translation of another language.
tt_content:sys_language_uid,pages:sys_language_uid,pages_language_overlay:sys_language_uid
The title of the series.
The title should reflect the naming of the series.
The date this series was begun.
The start date of a series should be the date that the first sermon in this series was presented on.
tx_wecsermons_series:enddate
The date this series ended on.
The end date of a series should be the last date a sermon in this series was presented on.
tx_wecsermons_series:startdate
The general description of the series.
The description can be used to give a brief summary of the series, and can be displayed on the series single view page.
Scripture referenced in this sermon.
Include here, any scripture you wish to associate with this sermon. These will be included when performing a search. Separate scriptures by a comma, ','.
